content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is one way to write the function `add_yearmonth` in Julia:
```
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df.ym = map(x -> string(x, "%Y%m"), df.dt)
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and creates a new column `ym` by applying the function `map` to the column `dt`. The `map` function applies the anonymous function `x -> string(x, "%Y%m")` to each element of `df.dt`, which extracts the year and month from the date and concatenates them together in the format "yyyymm".

You can call this function by passing a DataFrame as an argument, like this:
```
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will create a new column `ym` in the original DataFrame `df` with the extracted year and month.
